com.bitbar.recorder.extensions

Class ExtSolo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jayway.android.robotium.solo.Solo
      • com.bitbar.recorder.extensions.ExtSolo

  • public class ExtSolo
extends com.jayway.android.robotium.solo.Solo
    Extension of robotium-solo library. This class extends robotium solo library (Solo class) and makes testing easier. It requires robotium solo included too.
    Example:
     import android.test.ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2;
 import com.bitbar.testdroid.testapp.TestdroidTestAppActivity;
 import com.bitbar.recorder.extensions.ExtSolo;
 
 public class TestdroidTestAppActivityTest4 extends
        ActivityInstrumentationTestCase2<TestdroidTestAppActivity> {
 
     private ExtSolo solo;
 
     public TestdroidTestAppActivityTest() {
         super("com.bitbar.testdroid.testapp", TestdroidTestAppActivity.class);
     }
 
     public void setUp() throws Exception {
         super.setUp();
         solo = new ExtSolo(getInstrumentation(), getActivity(), this.getClass().getCanonicalName(), getName());
     } 
     
     public void tearDown() throws Exception {
         solo.finishOpenedActivities();
         solo.tearDown();
         super.tearDown();
    }
 
     public void testMethod() throws Exception {
         // Your staff
     }
 }
    Author:
    Roman Kierzkowski, Krzysztof Fonal, Michal Szpruta

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExtSolo

        public ExtSolo(Instrumentation inst,
       Activity activity,
       java.lang.String className,
       java.lang.String methodName)
        Constructor that takes in the instrumentation, activity, class name, method name ExtSolo instance should be initialized in setUp method
        Parameters:
        inst - Instrumentation instance
        activity - Activity instance
        className - name of the class (test class)
        methodName - name of the method
        Example:
         public void setUp() throws Exception {
     super.setUp();
     solo = new ExtSolo(getInstrumentation(), getActivity(), this.getClass().getCanonicalName(), getName());
 }
        Since:
        2.7

      • ExtSolo

        public ExtSolo(Instrumentation inst,
       com.jayway.android.robotium.solo.Solo solo)
        Deprecated. As of release 2.7, replaced by ExtSolo(Instrumentation inst, Activity activity, String className, String methodName)

    • Method Detail

      • assertCurrentActivity

        public void assertCurrentActivity(java.lang.String message,
                         java.lang.String name)
        Method used to assert current Activity
        Overrides:
        assertCurrentActivity in class com.jayway.android.robotium.solo.Solo
        Parameters:
        message - message, which is thrown when Activity was not found
        name - name of Activity
        Example:
         solo.assertCurrentActivity("Activity not found", "MainActivity");

        public void assertMemoryNotLow()
        Method used to assert memory
        Example:

        public void clickOnHtmlElement(java.lang.String xPath)
        Method used to click on HTML element inside WebView
        Parameters:
        xPath - XPATH to find element
        Example:
         solo.clickOnHtmlElement("(//a[@id = 'id'])[1]");
        Since:
        2.5

      • clickOnHtmlElement

        public void clickOnHtmlElement(java.lang.String tag,
                      java.lang.String id,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String className,
                      int index)
        Method used to click on HTML element inside WebView. If index is set to -1, click will be involved on every found element
        Parameters:
        tag - tag of element
        id - id of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        name - name of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        className - class of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        index - index of element, -1 if unknown
        Examples:
         solo.clickOnHtmlElement("input", "id", "", "login", 0);
 
 solo.clickOnHtmlElement("a", "", "", "", 5);
        Since:
        2.5

      • clickOnHtmlElement

        public void clickOnHtmlElement(java.lang.String tag,
                      java.lang.String id,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String className,
                      int index,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customAttributes)
        Method used to click on HTML element inside WebView. If index is set to -1, click will be involved on every found element
        Parameters:
        tag - tag of element
        id - id of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        name - name of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        className - class of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        index - index of element, -1 if unknown
        customAttributes - Map of extra attributes, null allowed
        Example:
         solo.clickOnHtmlElement("a", "id", "", "class", 0,
     new HashMap<String, String>() {
        {
            put("custom_id", "my_val");
        };
     }
 );
        Since:
        2.5

      • clickOnHtmlElementBySelector

        @Deprecated
public void clickOnHtmlElementBySelector(java.lang.String jQuerySelector)
        Deprecated. it's better to use clickOnHtmlElementByCssSelector(String, int) as this method convert jQuery selector to css selector since version 4.5 what is not always possible
        Method used to click on HTML element inside WebView
        Parameters:
        jQuerySelector - jQuery selector to find element
        Example:
         solo.clickOnHtmlElementBySelector("$('p.class1')");
        Since:
        4.3

      • clickOnHtmlElementByCssSelector

        public void clickOnHtmlElementByCssSelector(java.lang.String cssSelector)
        Method used to click on HTML element inside WebView
        Parameters:
        cssSelector - css selector to find element - first matched will be used
        Example:
         solo.clickOnHtmlElementByCssSelector("p#id.class1");
        Since:
        4.5

      • clickOnHtmlElementByCssSelector

        public void clickOnHtmlElementByCssSelector(java.lang.String cssSelector,
                                   int index)
        Method used to click on HTML element inside WebView
        Parameters:
        cssSelector - css selector to find element
        index - index of matched elements
        Example:
         solo.clickOnHtmlElementByCssSelector("p#id.class1", 2);
        Since:
        4.5

      • drag

        public void drag(float fromX,
        float toX,
        float fromY,
        float toY,
        int stepCount)
        Simulate touching a given location and dragging it to a new location
        Overrides:
        drag in class com.jayway.android.robotium.solo.Solo
        Parameters:
        fromX - initial x position
        toX - final x position
        fromY - initial y position
        toY - final y position
        stepCount - count of steps
        Examples:
         solo.drag(solo.toScreenX(0.744f), solo.toScreenX(0.031f),
     solo.toScreenY(0.302f), solo.toScreenY(0.671f), 4);
     
 solo.drag(500, 400, 100, 250, 5);

      • drag

        public void drag(float fromX,
        float toX,
        float fromY,
        float toY,
        int stepCount,
        int elapsed)
        Simulate touching a given location and dragging it to a new location in the specified time.
        Parameters:
        fromX - initial x position
        toX - final x position
        fromY - initial y position
        toY - final y position
        stepCount - count of steps
        elapsed - specified time in milliseconds
        Examples:
         solo.drag(solo.toScreenX(0.744f), solo.toScreenX(0.031f),
     solo.toScreenY(0.302f), solo.toScreenY(0.671f), 4, 100
 );
     
 solo.drag(500, 400, 100, 250, 5, 100);
        Since:
        1.0

      • elementExistsOnHtmlPage

        public boolean elementExistsOnHtmlPage(java.lang.String xPath)
        Method used to check, if HTML element exists on HTML page inside WebView
        Parameters:
        xPath - XPATH to find element
        Returns:
        true if element exists, false otherwise
        Example:
         assertTrue("Element does not exist - input(index: 0, name: j_username).",
     solo.elementExistsOnHtmlPage("(//input[@id = 'id'])[0]")
 );
        Since:
        2.5

      • elementExistsOnHtmlPage

        public boolean elementExistsOnHtmlPage(java.lang.String tag,
                              java.lang.String id,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String className,
                              int index)
        Method used to check, if HTML element exists on HTML page inside WebView
        Parameters:
        tag - tag of element
        id - id of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        name - name of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        className - class of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        index - index of element, -1 if unknown
        Returns:
        true if element exists, false otherwise
        Example:
         assertTrue("Element does not exist - input(index: 0, name: j_username).",
     solo.elementExistsOnHtmlPage("input", "", "j_username", "", 0)
 );
        Since:
        2.5

      • elementExistsOnHtmlPage

        public boolean elementExistsOnHtmlPage(java.lang.String tag,
                              java.lang.String id,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String className,
                              int index,
                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customAttributes)
        Method used to check, if HTML element exists on HTML page inside WebView
        Parameters:
        tag - tag of element
        id - id of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        name - name of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        className - class of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        index - index of element, -1 if unknown
        customAttributes - Map of extra attributes, null allowed
        Returns:
        true if element exists, false otherwise
        Example:
         assertTrue("Element does not exist - input(index: 0, name: j_username).",
     solo.elementExistsOnHtmlPage("input", "", "j_username", "", 0, 
          new HashMap<String, String>() {

          }
     )
 );

 );

        Returns:

     solo.elementExistsOnHtmlPageByCssSelector("p.class1")
 );

      • enterTextIntoHtmlElement

        public void enterTextIntoHtmlElement(java.lang.String tag,
                            java.lang.String id,
                            java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String className,
                            java.lang.String text,
                            int index)
        Method used to enter text into HTML element inside WebView. If index is set to -1, enter text will be involved on every found element

        name - name of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        className - class of element, null or empty string, if does not exist

        index - index of element, -1 if unknown
        Example:
         solo.enterTextIntoHtmlElement("input", "", "j_username", "", "login", 0);

        2.5

      • waitForHtmlElement

        public boolean waitForHtmlElement(java.lang.String xPath,
                         int time)
        Method used to wait during loading HTML element inside WebView
        Parameters:
        xPath - XPATH to find element
        time - time for waiting
        Returns:
        false if element does not appeared after specified time, true if element exist or just appeared
        Example:
         assertTrue("Wait for html element - input(index: 0, name: j_username) failed.",
     solo.waitForHtmlElement("(//input[@id = 'id'])[0]" 20000)
 );
        Since:
        2.5

      • waitForHtmlElement

        public boolean waitForHtmlElement(java.lang.String tag,
                         java.lang.String id,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String className,
                         int index,
                         int time)
        Method used to wait during loading HTML element inside WebView
        Parameters:
        tag - tag of element
        id - id of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        name - name of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        className - class of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        index - index of element, -1 if unknown
        time - time for waiting
        Returns:
        false if element does not appeared after specified time, true if element exist or just appeared
        Example:
         assertTrue("Wait for html element - input(index: 0, name: j_username) failed.",
     solo.waitForHtmlElement("input", "", "j_username", "", 0, 20000, null)
 );
        Since:
        2.5

      • waitForHtmlElement

        public boolean waitForHtmlElement(java.lang.String tag,
                         java.lang.String id,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         java.lang.String className,
                         int index,
                         int time,
                         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customAttributes)
        Method used to wait during loading HTML element inside WebView
        Parameters:
        tag - tag of element
        id - id of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        name - name of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        className - class of element, null or empty string, if does not exist
        index - index of element, -1 if unknown
        time - time for waiting
        customAttributes - Map of extra attributes, null allowed
        Returns:
        false if element does not appeared after specified time, true if element exist or just appeared
        Example:
         assertTrue("Wait for html element - input(index: 0, name: j_username) failed.",
     solo.waitForHtmlElement("input", "", "j_username", "",
         0, 20000, new HashMap<String, String>() {
              put("custom_id", "my_val");
         }
     )
 );
        Since:
        2.5

      • waitForHtmlElementBySelector

        @Deprecated
public boolean waitForHtmlElementBySelector(java.lang.String jQuerySelector,
                                              int time)
        Deprecated. it's better to use waitForHtmlElementByCssSelector(String, int, int) as this method convert jQuery selector to css selector since version 4.5 what is not always possible
        Method used to wait during loading HTML element inside WebView
        Parameters:
        jQuerySelector - jQuery selector to find element
        time - time for waiting
        Returns:
        false if element does not appeared after specified time, true if element exist or just appeared
        Example:
         assertTrue("Wait for html element - input(p, class: class1) failed.",
     solo.waitForHtmlElementBySelector("$('p.class1')", 20000)
 );
        Since:
        4.3

      • waitForHtmlElementByCssSelector

                                      int time)
        Method used to wait during loading HTML element inside WebView
        Parameters:

        time - time for waiting
        Returns:

        Example:

     solo.waitForHtmlElementByCssSelector("p#id.class1", 20000)
 );
